TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit PageParserFilter extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides an abstract base class for a page parser filter that is used by the ASP.NET parser to determine whether an item is allowed in the page at parse time.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example demonstrates how you can create a class that derives from the <xref:System.Web.UI.PageParserFilter> class to govern the behavior of the ASP.NET page parser. The `CustomPageParserFilter` is a parser filter that explicitly rejects code in the page. It does this by overriding the <xref:System.Web.UI.PageParserFilter.AllowCode%2A> property.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.UI.PageParserFilter#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.PageParserFilter/CS/CustomPageParserFilter.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.PageParserFilter#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.PageParserFilter/VB/CustomPageParserFilter.vb#2)]
To use the `CustomPageParserFilter` sample, place the class in your App_Code directory. You must configure the ASP.NET parsers to use the filter in the `pages` section of your site's Web.config configuration file. The following example configuration file shows the configuration for `CustomPageParserFilter`. When configured to use a parser filter, the ASP.NET parser throws an exception during the build if it encounters code in a page.
`<?xml version="1.0" ?>`
`<configuration xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/.NetConfiguration/v2.0">`
`<system.web>`
`<pages`
`pageParserFilterType="Samples.AspNet.CS.CustomPageParserFilter">`
`</pages>`
`</system.web>`
`</configuration>`

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the parser filter was called from the page.
Docs.value: if a parser filter was called from the page; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is set to `true` when an implementation of the <xref:System.Web.UI.PageParserFilter> class is invoked by calling the `ParseControl` method of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page> class or by calling the `ParseControl` method of the `TemplateControl` reference of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page> class.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Web.UI.CompilationMode GetCompilationMode (System.Web.UI.CompilationMode current);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance valuetype System.Web.UI.CompilationMode GetCompilationMode(valuetype System.Web.UI.CompilationMode current) cil managed
Public Overridable Function GetCompilationMode (current As CompilationMode) As CompilationMode
public: virtual System::Web::UI::CompilationMode GetCompilationMode(System::Web::UI::CompilationMode current);
abstract member GetCompilationMode : System.Web.UI.CompilationMode -> System.Web.UI.CompilationMode override this.GetCompilationMode : System.Web.UI.CompilationMode -> System.Web.UI.CompilationMode

Docs.param: The current compilation mode for the page.
Docs.summary: Retrieves the current compilation mode for the page.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateControlParser> class checks any associated <xref:System.Web.UI.PageParserFilter> instance to apply a compilation mode to the currently processed page. The default implementation of the <xref:System.Web.UI.PageParserFilter.GetCompilationMode%2A> method simply returns the <xref:System.Web.UI.CompilationMode> value that is passed in the current parameter. Override the <xref:System.Web.UI.PageParserFilter.GetCompilationMode%2A> method to use a specific or different <xref:System.Web.UI.CompilationMode> value.

Docs.summary: Returns a that should be used for pages or controls that are not dynamically compiled.
Docs.returns: The return that should be used for pages or controls that are not dynamically compiled. The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can override the <xref:System.Web.UI.PageParserFilter.GetNoCompileUserControlType%2A> method to specify the return type of pages or controls that are treated as if they are not dynamically compiled. The default is `null`.
<xref:System.Web.UI.PageParserFilter.GetNoCompileUserControlType%2A> is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual void Initialize ();
.method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void Initialize() cil managed
Protected Overridable Sub Initialize ()
protected: virtual void Initialize();
abstract member Initialize : unit -> unit override this.Initialize : unit -> unit

Docs.summary: Initializes a filter used for a page.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Because the <xref:System.Web.UI.PageParserFilter> class does not expose well-defined public constructors, it is initialized by the page parsers that use the <xref:System.Web.UI.PageParserFilter.Initialize%2A> method. Override the <xref:System.Web.UI.PageParserFilter.Initialize%2A> method to add your own custom initialization steps when an instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.PageParserFilter> is created and used by ASP.NET. The `virtualPath` parameter passed to the <xref:System.Web.UI.PageParserFilter.Initialize%2A> method sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.PageParserFilter.VirtualPath%2A> property, and cannot be `null`.

Docs.summary: Gets the line number that is currently being parsed in the file.
Docs.value: The integer value representing the line in the file that the parser filter is currently processing.

remarks.format:
## Remarks In a custom <xref:System.Web.UI.PageParserFilter> implementation, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.PageParserFilter.Line%2A> property to report where errors occur during parsing.
<xref:System.Web.UI.PageParserFilter.Line%2A> is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual int NumberOfControlsAllowed { get; }
.property instance int32 NumberOfControlsAllowed
Public Overridable ReadOnly Property NumberOfControlsAllowed As Integer
public: virtual property int NumberOfControlsAllowed { int get(); };
member this.NumberOfControlsAllowed : int

Docs.summary: Gets the maximum number of controls that a parser filter can parse for a single page.
Docs.value: The maximum number of controls a parser filter can parse for a page. The default value is 0, which indicates that no controls are parsed.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The ASP.NET page parser keeps track of the controls it parses, and if the number exceeds the limit set by a <xref:System.Web.UI.PageParserFilter> instance, it throws an <xref:System.Web.HttpException> exception.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual int NumberOfDirectDependenciesAllowed { get; }
.property instance int32 NumberOfDirectDependenciesAllowed
Public Overridable ReadOnly Property NumberOfDirectDependenciesAllowed As Integer
public: virtual property int NumberOfDirectDependenciesAllowed { int get(); };
member this.NumberOfDirectDependenciesAllowed : int

Docs.summary: Gets the maximum number of direct file dependencies that the page parser permits for a single page.
Docs.value: The maximum number of direct file dependencies the page parser can parse for a page. The default is 0, which that indicates no dependencies are allowed.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateParser> class keeps track of the number of direct and indirect file dependencies it parses, and if the number exceeds the limit set by a <xref:System.Web.UI.PageParserFilter> instance, it throws an exception.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool ProcessCodeConstruct (System.Web.UI.CodeConstructType codeType, string code);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool ProcessCodeConstruct(valuetype System.Web.UI.CodeConstructType codeType, string code) cil managed
Public Overridable Function ProcessCodeConstruct (codeType As CodeConstructType, code As String) As Boolean
public: virtual bool ProcessCodeConstruct(System::Web::UI::CodeConstructType codeType, System::String ^ code);
abstract member ProcessCodeConstruct : System.Web.UI.CodeConstructType * string -> bool override this.ProcessCodeConstruct : System.Web.UI.CodeConstructType * string -> bool

Docs.param: One of the enumeration values that identifies the type of the code construct.
The string literal that contains the code inside the code construct.
Docs.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether a code block should be processed by subsequent parser filters.
Docs.returns: if the parser should process a code construct further; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can override the <xref:System.Web.UI.PageParserFilter.ProcessCodeConstruct%2A> method to parse code contained in code constructs when implementing a custom <xref:System.Web.UI.PageParserFilter>. After processing the code, this method returns `true` if the parser should process the code further; otherwise, it returns `false`.
The type of allowed code constructs are the <xref:System.Web.UI.CodeConstructType> enumeration values.
<xref:System.Web.UI.PageParserFilter.ProcessCodeConstruct%2A> is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool ProcessDataBindingAttribute (string controlId, string name, string value);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool ProcessDataBindingAttribute(string controlId, string name, string value) cil managed
Public Overridable Function ProcessDataBindingAttribute (controlId As String, name As String, value As String) As Boolean
public: virtual bool ProcessDataBindingAttribute(System::String ^ controlId, System::String ^ name, System::String ^ value);
abstract member ProcessDataBindingAttribute : string * string * string -> bool override this.ProcessDataBindingAttribute : string * string * string -> bool

Docs.param: The ID of the control that contains the data binding attribute.
The name of the attribute with the data binding expression.
The data binding expression.
Docs.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether the parser filter processes a data binding expression in an attribute.
Docs.returns: if the parser filter processes data binding attributes; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can override the <xref:System.Web.UI.PageParserFilter.ProcessDataBindingAttribute%2A> method to allow the parser filter to process data binding expressions when implementing a custom <xref:System.Web.UI.PageParserFilter> class. An example of a data binding expression used with an attribute is `<%# expression %>`.
<xref:System.Web.UI.PageParserFilter.ProcessDataBindingAttribute%2A> is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool ProcessEventHookup (string controlId, string eventName, string handlerName);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool ProcessEventHookup(string controlId, string eventName, string handlerName) cil managed
Public Overridable Function ProcessEventHookup (controlId As String, eventName As String, handlerName As String) As Boolean
public: virtual bool ProcessEventHookup(System::String ^ controlId, System::String ^ eventName, System::String ^ handlerName);
abstract member ProcessEventHookup : string * string * string -> bool override this.ProcessEventHookup : string * string * string -> bool

Docs.param: The ID of the control whose event has the event handler to process.
The event name of the controlID to filter on.
The handler of the name to filter on.
Docs.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether event handlers should be processed further by the parser filter.
Docs.returns: if the parser processes event handlers; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can override the <xref:System.Web.UI.PageParserFilter.ProcessEventHookup%2A> method to allow the parser to process event hookups when implementing a custom <xref:System.Web.UI.PageParserFilter> class. An example of an event handler is providing a handler for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Button.Click> event of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Button> control.
<xref:System.Web.UI.PageParserFilter.ProcessEventHookup%2A> is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).
